page.title: 09FRUIT GROWING CONTINUED
page.content: If the frost does catch the blossoms the grower can spray them with jubellic acid.The fruit may be mis-shapen but there will be some fruit from the blossom. The major problem growing apples is scab.If you get a warm day following a wet period fungi forms in the soil and creeps up through the trees roots onto the the leaves and into the fruit.Spraying every fourteen days will stop this problem.There are many insects which cause a lot of trouble, mainly aphids, the red spider and caterpillars. Care must be taken while picking the fruit, any rough handling will bruise and damage the fruit.Birds are a problem with the cherries.Their red colour attracts them and although they are sour the birds still eat them.
